channel.title: [Turbo] Drinks & Barmaids I - Royally Excused (Canned)
channel.description:
**Welcome to [TURBO] - Drinks & Barmaids I**
Hosted by @KyoDaz
This setup follows simple forum rules. The setup will start once 7 players have signed up. The setup will start on Night 1.
**Gameplay**
Days will be 10 minutes long. Nights will be 5 minutes long. All actions must be done in your rolecard except for the faction kill. The town alignment is the [color=#FFD505]Yellow Poppy[/color]. The mafia alignment is the [color=#FFF1E6]White Primrose[/color]. The [color=#FFF1E6]White Primrose[/color] automatically win once majority is reached. The [color=#FFF1E6]White Primrose[/color] can only communicate during the night. The [color=#FFF1E6]White Primrose[/color] do not share rolecards and will be in seperate threads therefore any feedback is personal. The [color=#FFF1E6]White Primrose[/color] have a faction kill. The only role that will receive ability feedback is the [color=#FFD505]Constable[/color]. Items grant players a day ability. You will be told if you receive a [color=grey]Flintlock[/color] at the beginning of the day.
**Executions**
To accuse someone say "**/accuse [player]**" or "**/vote [player]**" Executions will be plurality. Players are not lynched until the end of the day unless all votes are received. Any ties in votes will be determined a no-lynch. If a lynch target has been decided via all votes being received but a player has not decided what they will do with a day ability (ect. **/nolynch Flintlock** or **/flintlock KyoDaz**) then the lynch will be delayed. Feel free to ask any scenarios with lynches.
**To Join**
To join, please '**/in**'
**Rolelist**
[color=#FFD505]Villager[/color] [color=#FFD505]Villager[/color] [color=#FFD505]Villager[/color] [color=#FFD505]Constable[/color] [color=#FFD505]Weaponsmith[/color] [color=#FFF1E6]Apprentice[/color] [color=#FFF1E6]Barmaid[/color]
**Role Cards & Items**
[details="Yellow Poppy Faction"] ># [color=#FFD505]Villager[/color] > You have no special abilities except your vote and voice. > Defeat all members of the [color=#FFF1E6]White Primrose[/color].
># [color=#FFD505]Constable[/color] > Every night you may decide to investigate a player and determine their alignment. > Defeat all members of the [color=#FFF1E6]White Primrose[/color].
># [color=#FFD505]Weaponsmith[/color] > Every night you may decide to give a player a [color=grey]Flintlock[/color] pistol. > Defeat all members of the [color=#FFF1E6]White Primrose[/color]. [/details]
[details="Primrose Faction"] > # [color=#FFF1E6]Apprentice[/color] > You have no special abilities except your vote and voice. > Defeat all members of the [color=#FFD505]Yellow Poppy[/color].
> # [color=#FFF1E6]Barmaid[/color] > Every night you may decide to occupy a player. > Defeat all members of the [color=#FFD505]Yellow Poppy[/color]. [/details]
[details="Items"] > # [color=grey]Flintlock[/color] >Item > You have a one-shot dayvig. >*Submit action in classcard.* [/details]
**Feedback**
[details="Feedback"]
FACTION = [color=#FFF1E6]White Primrose[/color] / [color=#FFD505]Yellow Poppy[/color] PLAYER = Full player name.
*Constable*
>According to your investigations, PLAYER is a member of the FACTION.
*Flintlock Obtained* >You have received a [color=grey]Flintlock[/color]!
> # [color=grey]Flintlock[/color] >Item > You have a one-shot dayvig. >*Submit action in classcard.* [/details]
Players:
1. x - Alive 2. x - Alive 3. x - Alive 4. x - Alive 5. x - Alive 6. x - Alive 7. x - Alive

item.title: [Turbo] Drinks & Barmaids I - Royally Excused (Canned)
item.dc:creator: Icibalus
item.description:
Look at this beast of a strategy. It’s superficially simmilar to the EpicMafia setup’s strategy but look! Everything’s flexible. There are worlds I can’t calculate because the strategy is still extremely and undeniably dependent on people, on the way people play the game.

Your strategy, your setup, is not based around that. It’s based on which of 5 worlds on the flowchart you live on. The interesting bit happens in the aftermath of there, not in the actual part where the strategy is employed

@Arete no.

Read full topic

item.title: [Turbo] Drinks & Barmaids I - Royally Excused (Canned)
item.dc:creator: Icibalus
item.description:
Let’s run through Cop9 and then I’ll explain why it’s superior to this game.

Cop
Villager (N0)
Villager
Villager
Villager
Villager
Villager

Mafia Goon
Mafia Goon

The strategy is hypoclaiming. Every single player in the game essentially pretends to be the Cop. They all say “N0 - Icibalus”, as an example, and the real cop puts out their actual read out there.

Bam! We’ve now got an interesting strategy where every single player has to actively manufacture or create reads, and there is real stakes to everybody’s reads. Even the N0 Green Peeks that people drop to cover the cop.

Why? If you choose a mafia as your N0, the mafia will probably never kill you because they know your N0 peek isn’t correct, and therefore are more likely to kill the cop. Therefore we can assume that anybody killed by the mafia is much more likely to have chosen a villager as their N0, and all their cover peeks are probably correct.

The operative word is probably. Depending on how the mafia and the village acts, the strategy changes. Do the mafia start to try and trick the villagers by killing somebody who peeks one of them green as their N0 to try and stop themselves from being lynched? Or do they just go out and try to kill the Cop before they basically doom the mafia to be killed?

This isn’t just WIFOM, though. The villagers can read the thread, read people, figure out which world they live in by watching carefully the actions of people, how they drop their peeks, how they try and create accurate fake peeks.

In my next book i’ll explain why this is objectively superior to this setup.

@Arete plurality, with maj + locked votes at LyLo

Read full topic

item.title: [Turbo] Drinks & Barmaids I - Royally Excused (Canned)
item.dc:creator: Icibalus
item.description:
sigh

Okay. Firstly, Cop9 is objectively superior to this if you want a good but complicated turbo with both strategy and reading.

KyoDaz:

The game ends maximum of D3. Minimum of D2, and that’s if they miss their mislynches or barmaid gets lucky.

mafia shoots Night 1
gunsmith gives mafia their gun, and they manage to plausibly shoot a villager
villagers lynch another villager

OOPS, THE GAME’S OVER D1!

Read full topic

item.title: [Turbo] Drinks & Barmaids I - Royally Excused (Canned)
item.dc:creator: KyoDaz
item.description:
KyoDaz:

Villager
Villager
Villager
Constable
Weaponsmith
Apprentice
Barmaid

N1 faction kill is Villager. Someone is gunned (does not matter who).
D2 Apprentice CCs cop. Someone shoots inside the cops. This day guarantees Apprentice dies if the gun is in play. Let’s say Apprentice loses CC and gets shot.
N2 Barmaid is left. Barmaid roleblocks gunsmith and kills cop, or vice versa depending on which clear they want alive left.
D3 it’s lylo with Barmaid, Villager and Gunsmith.

How is this not balanced? And that’s if Apprentice loses CC.

Read full topic

item.title: [Turbo] Drinks & Barmaids I - Royally Excused (Canned)
item.dc:creator: KyoDaz
item.description:
The game does not end instantly at all.
A lot of the time it ends up in someone gunned, GS + cop alive. They have a clear and two mislynches before they lose.
The game ends maximum of D3. Minimum of D2, and that’s if they miss their mislynches or barmaid gets lucky.

I think you also forget the point of the tag [Turbo].
It is intended to end relatively quickly.

Read full topic
